subject: Relationships
title: The Rebound Relationship Myth
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Rebound Relationship Myth.

hook.text: 'The best way to get over someone is to get under someone else.' Pop wisdom says yes. Science says maybe.

buildup.text: Rebound relationships are new connections entered quickly after a breakup, often to soothe emotional pain.

discovery.text: Some studies show rebounds boost self-esteem and confidence. Others show they delay genuine emotional processing.

twist.text: The outcome depends on motivation. Seeking connection works; seeking distraction backfires.

climax.text: A rebound isn't automatically bad. But using another person as emotional anesthesia has a cost â€” for both.

punchline.text: Rebounds can heal or harm. Intent determines which.

quiz.question: When are rebounds most likely to be harmful?
options: When motivated by distraction rather than genuine connection
